details.summary: We work in Finland to support UK policies on Europe, including improving the single market and increasing trade and investment  to boost economic growth in both countries.  We provide high-quality consular services to Britons visiting Finland.
details.description:
We support the work of the Northern Future Forum, which brings together heads of government from across the Nordic Baltic region and the UK to identify and address important issues facing our citizens.

We have shared interests with Finland in trade liberalisation, international security, conflict prevention and resolution, especially in the Middle East, and we exchange expertise on civilian crisis management and peace mediation.
details.services:
Out-of-hours emergency assistance

British nationals who need emergency assistance outside normal office hours should call +358 (0) 9 2286 5100

Emergency travel documents

Information about how to get an emergency travel document if your UK passport is lost or stolen

Passport renewal

For information on how to apply for your first passport or renew an existing passport, please visit the overseas passport section of this website.

Please note that our consulates cannot deal with individual enquiries about passport applications.

Visas

The British Embassy in Helsinki does not process visa applications. For enquiries and the application procedure, please refer to the Finland page of the UK Border Agency website

Living in Finland

A guide for British nationals living, or planning to live, in Finland.

Registering a birth or death, getting married in Finland

Understanding your legal requirements in Finland and how you can register a birth or death, and information on legal documents for couples marrying or entering into civil partnerships abroad

Notarial services

Information about the notarial services available at the embassy

Legal advice

A list of English speaking lawyers and interpreters who may be able to help you with official transactions in Finland. Please note that inclusion in this list does not constitute official endorsement by the British Embassy or the UK government.

See also our information pack on the Finnish prison system

Legalisation Service

See the legalisation guidance leaflet for information on how to get official confirmation that your UK public documentation is genuine so it can be accepted by foreign authorities. The UK does not require any documents to be legalised for use within the UK.

How else we can help

In addition to the services listed above we can also:

  • provide information about transferring funds
  • provide appropriate help if you have suffered rape or serious assault, are a victim of other crime, or are in hospital
  • help people with mental illness
  • do all we properly can to contact you within 24 hours of being told that you have been detained
  • offer support and help in a range of other cases, such as child abductions, death of relatives overseas, missing people and kidnapping
  • contact family or friends for you if you want
  • make special arrangements in cases of terrorism, civil disturbances or natural disasters

UK law says we have to charge for some services. Details of our current fees and the standards of service you can expect to receive are on display in all our consular offices

What we cannot do for you

Although we try to help British nationals in a wide range of situations, we cannot:

  • get you out of prison, prevent the local authorities from deporting you after your prison sentence, or interfere in criminal or civil court proceedings
  • help you enter a country, for example, if you do not have a visa or your passport is not valid, as we cannot interfere in another country’s immigration policy or procedures
  • give you legal advice, investigate crimes or carry out searches for missing people, although we can give you details of people who may be able to help you in these cases, such as English-speaking lawyers
  • get you better treatment in hospital or prison than is given to local people
  • pay any bills or give you money (in very exceptional circumstances we may lend you some money from public funds, which you will have to pay back)
  • make travel arrangements for you, or find you work or accommodation
  • make business arrangements on your behalf

details.access_and_opening_times:
Opening hours

Monday to Friday, 9am to 4.30pm

Consular Section

Telephone enquiries

  • Monday to Friday, 10am to midday
  • Telephone: +358 (0) 9 2286 5100

Visits

By appointment only.

Appointments should be made at least 24 hours in advance, preferably by email to Helsinki.ConsularEnquiries@fco.gov.uk or by telephone during the above-mentioned enquiries time.

Closed on Saturday and Sunday

Visas

The British Embassy Helsinki does not process visa applications. For enquiries and the application procedure, please refer to the Finland page on the UK Border Agency website.

2013 public holidays

  • Tuesday 1 January
  • Thursday 28 March
  • Friday 29 March
  • Monday 1 April
  • Wednesday 1 May
  • Thursday 9 May
  • Friday 21 June
  • Monday 26 August
  • Friday 1 November
  • Friday 6 December
  • Tuesday 24 December
  • Wednesday 25 December
  • Thursday 26 December

Getting to the embassy

Our office is located at Itäinen Puistotie 17 in the Kaivopuisto area of southern Helsinki. Find us on the map.

Taxis

Taxis in Helsinki are easy to use and often accept debit and credit cards as well as cash. Call +358 (0) 100 0700 to book a taxi.

Public transport

The Kaivopuisto tram stop is serviced by trams 1 and 3. The nearest bus stop is Meritori, serviced by bus 24.

For more information, visit the journey planner of the Helsinki Regional Transport Authority (HSL).

details.summary: UK Trade & Investment (UKTI) helps UK-based companies succeed in the global economy. We also help overseas companies bring their high-quality investment to the UK’s dynamic economy.
details.description:
UKTI offers expertise and contacts through its extensive network of specialists in the UK, and in British embassies and other diplomatic offices around the world. We provide companies with the tools they require to be competitive on the world stage.

Responsibilities

UKTI in Finland helps companies in Britain increase their competitiveness through overseas trade in Finland. We also offer professional, authoritative and personalised assistance to help companies in Finland locate and expand in the UK.

You can find out more about how we are boosting trade and investment between Britain and Finland .
details.services:
Start a business in the UK

UKTI offers dedicated, professional, personalised assistance to help you locate and expand your business in the UK, read about our investment services or contact us to find out more.

Export from the UK

UKTI can assist you on every step of the exporting journey in both the UK and overseas, read about our exporting services or contact us to find out more.

Events

UKTI and its partners stage events in the UK and abroad to help companies looking to export. You can browse scheduled events and register for alerts.

Business opportunities

UKTI is always looking to provide an international network of opportunities for UK Companies looking to export. You can search these opportunities and register for alerts.
